summary:
Currently working as Product Development Engineer at Earth imaging company Planet (https://www.planet.com/). Mainly working on environmental change detection and monitoring based on the planetary variables in the context of ecosystem restoration. 
 
As project/technical lead of the ESA project Restore-IT, I work on translating satellite data into environmental impact indicators to quantify and monitor the effectiveness of restoration activities. Within the ESA's Climate Change Initiative (CCI) Science Team I am working on improving CCI Soil Moisture data quality by finding physical-based flagging solutions. In the position of technical lead or support, I also have experience with projects related to financial inclusion and sustainable agriculture of smallholder farmers.

In 2017 I completed my master's degree in Climate Physics at the Institute of Marine and Atmospheric research (IMAU) in Utrecht, which followed upon my bachelor's degree in Earth Sciences (Cum Laude) at the Free University in Amsterdam.

projects.title: Thinking about new ways of using meteorological data
projects.description:
We are aware that nature changes around us: the sea level is rising, heat waves and extreme precipitation occur occur more often , glaciers are melting, air and water quality decreases etc, but what does climate change mean directly for us, for our health, and for our children? Why is it importance to take action meself?

After my extreme(ly cold) study experience in Canada, I am now waiting till my official graduation in Climate Physics. Actually I feel very excited to start a new adventure in research. Its on my heart to do research relating to climate change from a demand-driven perspective. I want to do a PhD which gains knowledge as an answer to a societal problem, which can be applied in collobaration with local partners and users. I notice that it is hard to find a job fullfilling this wish via standard vacancies, as the demand has to be investigated to formulate the research question. However, I believe that a new way of starting research is the next step in climate science, to connect data, researchers, companies and citizens better.

You can help me with my wish by sharing this update or my Linked In page with your network. 
I am looking for innovative research opportunities related to climate change. The following themes are particularly in interest for me: 
- The interactions between climate change and health for western countries,
- Reducing climate vulnerability in developing countries by knowledge transfer and training of local people. 
Please let me know if you are interested in discussing ideas about these two themes.

company.name: VanderSat - Satellite observed water data. Globally. Daily.

profile_positions.description:
VanderSat turns satellite-derived climate data into valuable soil moisture information across all industries. Whether you operate regionally, nationally or globally. VanderSat provides the highest resolution, cost-effective and information-rich soil moisture data in the world. With daily observations you can make better, more informed decisions at any scale - whether you are monitoring crops, predicting the weather, performing predictive analysis, or preventing forest fires. We deliver key input at an unprecedented scale.

Working at VanderSat appeals greatly to Mendy because of their ambition to provide technical solutions to positively impact this Earth. Always thinking about new ways to link people, different disciplines and data, Mendy strives towards co-developing innovate satellite-based service that have impact on the long term.

volunteer_experiences.description: Every Sunday in the center of Leiden, we are organizing a community meal for everybody that would like to have more social contact. It's initiated by several churches in Leiden, from the observation of a paradoxical truth: that there is a multitude of lonely people in a very densely populated area. This brought up the idea of starting to share food, as we all have to eat anyway, next to that it's relaxing, enjoyable and brings a family atmosphere.

Tijdens de Climate Hackathon 2016 in Rotterdam heb ik samen met mijn team 24 uur nagedacht over het probleem in de Nederlandse steden betreffende luchtkwaliteit. Weinig mensen weten hier iets van af, terwijl er veel data (RIVM, crowdsourcing etc) beschikbaar is. Hier hebben wij iets op bedacht.

Het project Green Tree maakt luchtkwaliteit zichtbaar. Op een drukbezochte plek in de stad, waar al bestaande meetinstrumenten staan, `planten' wij een Green Tree. Dit is een kunstobject die real-time de luchtkwaliteit visualiseert voor die plek door middel van kleur. De boom wordt blauw als de lucht gezond is, terwijl rood duidt op ongezonde lucht. Het kleurensysteem is gebaseerd op de luchtkwaliteitsindex van het RIVM.

De boom trekt op een creatieve manier de aandacht en triggert mensen om na te denken over wat luchtkwaliteit is, waardoor het wordt veroorzaakt en wat het effect is op hun eigen gezondheid. Voor meer verdieping willen we website bouwen, waar de nadruk ligt op de verbinding van bestaande data, kennis en tools (o.a. Mijn Luchtkwaliteitapp).

Ook denken wij na over een interactief element welke door middel van positieve communicatie het
gedrag op die plek t.o.v. luchtkwaliteit verbetert. Samen maken wij de mensen bewust over
luchtkwaliteit!

Een buurtmaaltijd, elke dinsdag in Kanaleneiland, voor mensen die dit uit financieel of sociaal oogpunt goed kunnen gebruiken. Ik kook graag voor deze groep en we gaan vanaf september ook verdiepingsavonden houden (lezingen en gesprekken over actuele onderwerpen o.a. duurzaamheid, eenzaamheid, geloof) .
Kinderen met een multiculturele achtergrond  in groep 7 en 8 van de basisschool de Morgenster in Amsterdam begeleid met hun huiswerk.

In een team hebben wij een school gebouwd samen met de lokale bevolking in het kleine plaatsje Mata de Platano in Ecuador. Het is niet zo dat de hulp in één richting was, want wat ben ik de dorpsbewoners nog steeds dankbaar dat ze mij hun leven in eenvoud, liefde en dichtbij de natuur lieten zien.
